title: Simple Coloring
description: Use candidate coloring to track chains and find powerful eliminations

steps.title: Color-Based Logic
steps.content:
Learn **Simple Coloring** - using colors to track candidate chains.

**What You'll Learn:**
- Coloring candidates in chains
- Color traps and wraps
- Advanced elimination rules

**Time Estimate:** 40 minutes

steps.title: Simple Coloring Technique
steps.content:
**Coloring Concept:**
When a digit appears exactly twice in a unit (conjugate pair), color them alternately:
- If one is TRUE, the other is FALSE
- Follow chains of conjugate pairs
- Look for contradictions or eliminations

**Color Rules:**
1. **Twice in Same Unit Rule**: If two cells of same color appear in same unit ‚Üí eliminate that color
2. **Sees Two Colors Rule**: If a cell sees both colors ‚Üí it can't be that digit

**Example:**
Digit 5 conjugate pairs in Row 3:
- R3C2 and R3C7 (only two 5s in Row 3)
- Color R3C2 blue, R3C7 green

If R3C2 is 5 (blue) ‚Üí R3C7 is not 5 (green color false)
If R3C2 is not 5 (blue false) ‚Üí R3C7 is 5 (green true)

Follow chains through grid using conjugate pairs.

**Applications:**
- Find contradictions (two blues in same unit)
- Find eliminations (cell sees both colors)
- Solve complex puzzles

steps.title: Practice Simple Coloring
steps.content:
Apply coloring technique to master puzzles.

**Goal:** Complete at least 2 of 3 puzzles

puzzles.title: Basic Coloring
hints: Find conjugate pairs (digit appears exactly twice in unit)
Look for cells seeing both colors
Eliminate that digit from those cells

puzzles.title: Color Chains
hints: Follow chains through multiple conjugate pairs

questions.question: What is a conjugate pair?
options: Any two cells next to each other
Two cells in a unit where a digit appears exactly twice
questions.explanation: A conjugate pair is when a digit appears in exactly 2 cells in a unit - one must be true, the other false.

questions.question: In Simple Coloring, when can you eliminate a candidate?
options: When a cell sees both colors of a chain
When two cells have the same color
questions.explanation: If a cell sees both colors in a chain, it cannot be that digit because one of the colors must be true.

questions.question: Why is coloring considered an advanced technique?
options: Requires tracking complex chains across the grid and logical reasoning about true/false states
questions.explanation: Coloring requires tracking chains of conjugate pairs across the entire grid and reasoning about true/false states - a complex cognitive task.
